dcterms:creator: Lasha Abzianidze
Johannes Bjerva
Kilian Evang
Hessel Haagsma
Rik van Noord
Pierre Ludmann
Duc-Duy Nguyen
Johan Bos
dcterms:description: The Parallel Meaning Bank (PMB) is a semantically annotated parallel corpus for multiple languages, consisting of a large collection of parallel texts, each accompanied by a formal meaning representation based on Discourse Representation Theory (DRT). It is used for corpus-based studies on formal semantic phenomena and for developing and evaluating semantic processing tasks such as text-to-meaning parsing and meaning-to-text generation.
dcterms:title: Parallel Meaning Bank (PMB)

dcterms:creator: Mark Steedman
dcterms:description: Combinatory Categorical Grammar (CCG) is a lexicalised grammar formalism used in the PMB to steer compositional semantics. It comprises basic categories from which function categories can be composed using combinatorial rules.
dcterms:title: Combinatory Categorical Grammar (CCG)

dcterms:creator: Laura Banarescu
Claire Bonial
Shu Cai
Madalina Georgescu
Kira Griffitt
Ulf Hermjakob
Kevin Knight
Philipp Koehn
Martha Palmer
Nathan Schneider
dcterms:description: Abstract Meaning Representation (AMR) is a semantic representation framework that captures the meaning of sentences in a structured format. It is used for large-scale semantic annotation efforts.
dcterms:title: Abstract Meaning Representation (AMR)

dcterms:creator: B. M. Lake
M. Baroni
dcterms:description: SCAN is a dataset designed to evaluate the compositional skills of sequence-to-sequence recurrent networks, focusing on generalization without systematicity.
dcterms:title: SCAN

dcterms:creator: N. Kim
T. Linzen
dcterms:description: COGS is a dataset that presents a compositional generalization challenge based on semantic interpretation, testing the ability of models to generalize to novel combinations of known components.
dcterms:title: COGS

dcterms:creator: Rashmi Prasad
Nikhil Dinesh
Alan Lee
Eleni Miltsakaki
Livio Robaldo
Aravind Joshi
Bonnie Webber
dcterms:description: The Penn Discourse TreeBank 2.0 is a corpus that provides annotations for discourse relations in texts, facilitating research in discourse analysis and related fields.
dcterms:title: Penn Discourse TreeBank 2.0

dcterms:creator: T. O’Gorman
M. Regan
K. Griffitt
U. Hermjakob
K. Knight
M. Palmer
dcterms:description: The multi-sentence AMR corpus extends the AMR framework to include multiple sentences, allowing for the annotation of discourse and coreference across sentences.
dcterms:title: Multi-sentence AMR corpus

dcterms:creator: D. T. Haug
J. Y. Findlay
A. Yıldırım
dcterms:description: The DRS (Discourse Representation Structure) dataset contains semantically annotated sentences of varying lengths, focusing on natural length and discourse representation.
dcterms:title: DRS (Discourse Representation Structure)
